p: Fifty E. coli UTI isolates were screened for their abilities to form a biofilm on polystyrene surface ( Table 4). The results showed that 44% of the isolates were able to form biofilm with optical density 570 (OD570) values ranging from 0.102 to 0.543 and were considered as low-grade positive, whereas the other strains did not show any biofilm formation. The majority of biofilm-forming bacteria were isolated from adult female samples (17 isolates), while only one strain was isolated from a child. Five strains isolated from males were considered as low-grade positive. Reference E. coli ATCC 25922 appeared as a low-grade positive biofilm. Analysis of variance (ANOVA) indicated that there was a non-significant effect of age (F = 0.758, p > 0.05) or gender (F = 0.489, p > 0.05) of the specimen on biofilm formation.
